title: Permabanned - For this?
body:

replies.body:
This likely would not have been a perma-ban on its own.

The system continually escalates punishment levels for people who do not change their behavior after previous warnings and punishments. On your previous punishment, which should be in your email, you were told it was your final warning and the next punishment would result in a permanent account suspension.

This perma-ban was issued based upon a long history of verbal harassment, not from a single game. This can be a little confusing when looking at the chat log of a single game, but I hope this helps add some clarity.
Rightfully banned
You've apparently never stepped foot outside.

It's amusing when penalized players try to use this as an excuse for their behavior. League of Legends is a private, moderated environment owned and maintained by Riot. If you were to go to someone's home and behave this poorly to the host or their guests, you'd expect to be kicked out. If you were at the store and you were harassing dozens of other shoppers, you'd expect to be kicked out. The game is their domain and it's their responsibility to ensure no one disrupts what they've created and whose success depends on as many consumers having a positive experience as possible.

"People behave poorly irl and suffer no repercussions, so I should be able to behave poorly in game without repercussions."

This line of reasoning evaporates if you think about it for more than 60 seconds. Learn how to play with others or go play solitaire.

You don't get permabanned because of just one game. They review past games where you got reported for the same reason(s) and judge on that (used to be 5 games but things change, could be more ). The card you get is just the most recent game. The only reason for you to go straight to permaban and not get any restrictions beforehand is if you use nonaprroved 3rd party software. It clearly states it's because of your behaviour so you are either a repeated offender ( and if so then you deserved it ) or it's a one in a million fluke. If you think you got banned for no reason submit a ticket and prove your claim to riot.
